intro: Eragrostiella coromandeliana, commonly known as the Coromandel grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including India, Indonesia, and parts of Africa. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb with slender, tufted stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, which are characteristic of the grass family. Eragrostiella coromandeliana is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
